children.subject: Based on the course description, this sounds like a "technical course that cannot fulfill any requirements for your major" so I would think the deadline is this week. however, this is a college policy so your ESS Advisor would be the best person to ask.

Hello-I am and EECS student and I am taking Statistics 89A which does not count toward anything but a general elective.

Just to be sure, do I have to change to P/NP this week or can I wait?  I would rather wait until after the midterm which isn't until March.

Thank you

@Cindy Conners  would need to answer. 

As of a week ago though, the waitlist was only one person and there were extra seats in the course.
The wait list stopped automatically processing 2 weeks ago. I just manually cleared the wait list this morning (and responded to your email).

Hello! I'm anxious because the deadline to add a class is this Friday but I'm still on the waitlist of CS C100. May I ask is the waitlist still processing 4 times a day as the previous post stated? I checked the class.berkeley.edu website at those time points but didn't see any update on the waitlist.

Thanks for answering.
please contact your college about their late change procedures.
Is there still the option for one semester late change?

history.content:
Friday, February 16 at 11:59 p.m., is the deadline to add or drop courses. 

We all know that CalCentral is not perfect, so we discourage students from waiting until the last minute to make desired changes. For technical support with CalCentral, see here.

Please note that CalCentral will not allow you to drop a course if it will place you below the minimum number of units required by your college. If you are eligible for a "reduced courseload", you should make that request early this week to allow processing time. Some of the reasons students might be eligible are if they're graduating this semester, a student parent, working a paid job, completing an honors thesis, or in the Disabled Students Program. Contact your college for more information. 

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

For EECS Students Only: Friday is also the deadline to change your grading option in technical courses that cannot fulfill any requirements for your major. Please remember that technical courses that can be used to fulfill any requirement for your major must be taken for a letter grade. In addition to the core major courses, many COE majors include a minimum number of technical elective units or engineering units, so if the course you are taking can count toward those unit requirements for your degree, you must take it for a letter grade.

Please note that CalCentral will let you change your grading option in any class until the end of the tenth week, March 23. While COE policy states that you may change your grading option in your H/SS courses until the tenth week, you are not permitted to change your grading option in your technical courses after the end of the fifth week (Friday, February 16). If you change the grading option for any of your technical courses after Friday (2/16), the grading option will be changed back.
history.subject: Friday is add/drop deadline! (P/NP for EECS)
